Versions of Heritrix from SVN TRUNK will have odd numbers in the second 
position, eg. the '15' in 1.15.2. (That's the current label of what's in 
SVN.) No official release will have such an odd middle number, though 
you can grab the auto-builds off our build box, or build yourself from 
source locally, if you're adventurous.

1.14.1 is the most recent official release on the 1.X codeline.

There haven't been any substantive changes to the 1.X codeline since 
that release, which was less than a month ago. All updates to robots 
handling were in 1.14.1, as you can see from the changelog:

http://webteam.archive.org/jira/browse/HER?report=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.project:changelog-panel

I suggest sticking with the official release unless you're sure you've 
seen something you need get committed to SVN.

Javadocs on the website are rebuilt and uploaded on each auto-build, so 
reflect the SVN version number.

- Gordon @ IA

Matt Kent wrote:
> It seems that Heritrix 1.14.1 is the most recent release. The Javadoc
> claims it represents version 1.15.2, but I can find no evidence of said
> version in SVN or Jira. Does a tag of Heritrix 1.15.2 exist anywhere?
> I'm interested in the updates to the robots.txt stuff.
